thread.title: Arkansas' DeBriyn named to SWC Hall of Fame
thread.title_full: Arkansas' DeBriyn named to SWC Hall of Fame

title: Arkansas' DeBriyn named to SWC Hall of Fame
text:
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) â€” Former Arkansas baseball coach Norm DeBriyn has been added to the Southwest Conference Hall of Fame.
The university said DeBriyn joined eight other inducted Monday at a luncheon in Dallas. The hall is located inside the Texas Sports Hall of Fame in Waco, Texas.
DeBriyn coached the Razorbacks for 33 years and their top finish nationally was as runner-up in the 1979 College World Series.
The Razorbacks won 64 percent of their games under DeBriyn, who led the team to 1,161 victories. Arkansas won two Southwest Conference titles under DeBriyn, along with one Southeastern Conference title. He also took the team to 15 NCAA tournaments and four appearances at the College World Series in Omaha, Nebraska.
He has been in the Arkansas Sports Hall of Fame since 1991.
